Topic.Title: What's going on with MSFT?

Message.Msg: $50 by 1st qtr 2014 IMHO overly optimystic. Clumsy/tonedeaf XBox One pr/marketing "plan" that had to be redone completely, in addition to tonedeaf/clumsy/halfcooked release of Win 8 that also had to be redone. I say it'll take past 1st qtr for peeps to begin to discount the past, a very expensive proposition now and throughout first qtr 2014. Of course a substantial increase in 4th qtr 2013 revenues will find us shareholders in Spring 50 sometime before March 2014, that is my prescription, but be cognosense that I'm neither a pharmacist, medical doctor, nor psychiatrist, so what do I know!

But I'm no prophet, nor warlock, nor wizard minus I don't own nor do I use nor do I seek the use of fortune telling gear, so what do I really know about MSFT layouts! You could argue that XBox/Windows games are movies with interactivity, but for the sake of Peace let us all agree for once!

Message.Title: Xbox Controversies, Sweat Stains Mar Microsoft’s Big Month
Message.Msg: Google it. Quoting: "June ought to have been a banner month for Microsoft (MSFT) CEO Steve Ballmer, who had a bevy of new partnerships and products to announce. Yet it’s been a total bust for Microsoft investors. "Shares of the company traded around $34.65 on Thursday, within 30 cents of their close at the end of May. That’s after the company hyped its next-gen Xbox and gave its flagging Windows 8 operating system a massive overhaul. Seeking to catch a bit of Apple’s (AAPL) cachet, Microsoft also unveiled a long-awaited version of Office for the iPhone. Additionally, Bing pushed Google search off the Siri service. Sometime rival Oracle (ORCL) even signed up for a cloud partnership on Microsoft's Azure platform. "How could so much seeming progress add up to so little? "The antiperspirant factor "Well, Ballmer isn’t exactly a master showman – the Internets were alive with some less-than-flattering photos of the CEO on stage at Microsoft's Build conference this week. The possible antiperspirant glitch that led to what seemed to be sweat stains on Ballmer's shirt was just one of a slew of missteps and missed opportunities that detracted and distracted from the many announcements."

Message.Title: Android-running “Nokia Lumia 920” can be had for $60
Message.Msg: Google it. Quoting: "We regularly hear Android folk complaining that Nokia should make an Android version of their flagship Windows Phones. "Now Plonge on DH Gate has answered their prayers, and all at the low-low price of only $60. "That buys you a dual-SIM device with a memory card support and removable battery running Android 4.0, thereby addressing all of the the complaints those Android users may have about the handset. "Of course for Android users used to 1080P handsets the VGA screen and 3 megapixel camera grate a bit, but I am sure that is a price they are willing to pay to run their favourite skinnable OS.
